intro: Hygrochilus subparishii, commonly known as the Parish's hygrochilus, is a rare flowering plant belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, spurred petals and is typically found in moist, shaded habitats. The plant has small, green leaves and produces fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers. It is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia, where it thrives in humid, tropical environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
